intro: Fuerstia adpressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fuegian daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to coastal environments. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping it conserve water in arid conditions. Fuerstia adpressa is often found in the southern regions of Chile and Argentina.
